column1: Khadyzhensk (Russian: Хады́женск) is a town in Apsheronsky District of Krasnodar Krai
column4: 113 kilometers (70 mi) southeast of Krasnodar. Population: 21

column1: It was founded in 1864 as the stanitsa of Khadyzhenskaya (Хадыженская). Town status was granted to it in 1949.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated within Apsheronsky District as the Town of Khadyzhensk. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Khadyzhensk is incorporated within Apsheronsky Municipal District as Khadyzhenskoye Urban Settlement.
